channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêThe current state of JavaScript on the Web„ÄëÁΩëÁªú‰∏äJavaScriptÁöÑÂΩìÂâçÁä∂ÊÄÅ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã726 ‚Äî March 7, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Report on How the Web is Really Using JavaScript ‚Äî Each year, the HTTP Archive puts together the Web Almanac, a report on the ‚Äòstate of the Web‚Äô. The JavaScript section has just gone live and goes into depth on how much JS we‚Äôre using (or failing to use!), the popularity of TypeScript, loading methods, Web Worker use, and, yes, jQuery still leads the¬†way!

HTTP Archive

Lynx: A Fresh Way to Build Apps from Web Technologies ‚Äî Lynx is a new set of tools for building JavaScript-powered native and Web apps that draws inspiration from React Native but aims to be more modular and flexible (and eventually framework agnostic). It comes from, and is used by, TikTok, and comes with its own QuickJS-based JavaScript¬†engine.

Xuan Huang and the Lynx Team

Build Dynamic Forms with a JSON-Powered White-Label Form Builder ‚Äî Create fully customizable, JSON-driven forms in your JavaScript app with SurveyJS. Our drag-and-drop form-building UI component integrates seamlessly with React, Angular, Vue 3, and vanilla JS, plus has no backend restrictions. Perfect for form-heavy¬†apps.

SurveyJS sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.8 ‚Äî Four months in the making, TypeScript 5.8 lands with a strong Node focus. You can now use require() for ES modules in the nodenext module, there‚Äôs a new node18 module for developers who want to keep targeting Node 18, and most notably there‚Äôs now an --erasableSyntaxOnly option to ensure no TypeScript-only runtime semantics can be¬†used.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • The Svelte team shares its latest monthly update of what's new.

  • Straightforward examples of basic design patterns implemented in pure JavaScript.

  • ü§ñ The folks behind the State of JS survey are running State of Web Dev AI, a new survey focused on the use of AI in modern Web¬†development.

RELEASES:

  • Electron 35.0 ‚Äì You can now attach a preload script to Service Workers. Dependencies are also bumped to Chromium 134 and Node¬†22.14.

  • Angular 19.2 ‚Äì We mentioned this last week but there's now an official post with more¬†details.

  • React Aria March Release ‚Äì Adobe's fantastic suite of React¬†components.

  • zx 8.4 ‚Äì Google's tool for better Node shell¬†scripting.

  • eslint-plugin-vue v10.0.0, Readability.js 0.6, NodeBB 4.1

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

JavaScript Fatigue Strikes Back ‚Äî A developer with ‚Äòa decade away‚Äô from writing JavaScript returns to find that one thing hasn‚Äôt changed: ‚ÄúChoosing the right JavaScript framework is hard, man.‚Äù

Allen Pike

Dr. Axel's 'Sales Pitch' for TypeScript ‚Äî As one of JavaScript‚Äôs most esteemed writers, if Dr. Axel can‚Äôt convince you of the value of TypeScript, who¬†could?

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Instrument, Monitor, Fix: A Hands-On Debugging Class ‚Äî Join us for a hands-on session where you‚Äôll build it, watch it break, debug it, and go from ‚Äúno idea what‚Äôs wrong‚Äù to fixing¬†issues.

Sentry sponsor

Reimplementing Crossy Road in JavaScript ‚Äî Two well put together tutorials so far covering reimplementing Crossy Road with either Three.js or React Three Fiber. In both written or video¬†form.

Hunor M√°rton Borb√©ly

Node Just Added TypeScript Support. What Does That Mean for¬†Deno? ‚Äî The Deno team, who went all in on TypeScript from day one, reflects on the continued increase in levels of support for TypeScript in Node and how their approaches¬†differ.

Andy Jiang and Ryan Dahl

üìÑ Creating an Image Comparison Slider in 6 Lines of JavaScript Muffin Man

üìÑ Is Biome Ready to Replace Prettier and ESLint? Nicolas Pendon

üìÑ Speeding Up the JS Ecosystem with Rust and JavaScript Plugins Marvin Hagemeister

üìÑ JavaScript Best Practice: Use return await Tam√°s Sallai

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

TanStack Form v1.0: Headless, Type-Safe Form State Management ‚Äî A type-safe, framework agnostic (React, Vue, Angular, Solid and Lit are all supported out of the box), headless and isomorphic way to create and work with forms, with this v1.0 release over two years in the making. If you already use things like Formik or React Hook Form and are wondering how it differs, here‚Äôs a comparison¬†table.

Tanner Linsley

PDFSlick 2.2: View and Interact with PDF Documents ‚Äî A full-featured PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and other JS apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it uses Zustand to provide a reactive store for documents. Demo.

Vancho Stojkov

üîí Protect Against AI Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

Electron App Boilerplate with Modern Dependencies ‚Äî A basic template app that uses React 19, Tailwind CSS 4, shadcn/ui, Electron Vite, Biome, and includes a GitHub Actions release¬†workflow.

Dalton Menezes

Fable: A F# to JavaScript Compiler ‚Äî If you fancy F#‚Äôs flavor of almost-entirely-functional development, this could be for you. GitHub¬†repo.

Fable

React Data Table: Responsive Dynamic Table Component ‚Äî Simple and clean, but flexible. Includes features like column sorting and pagination out of the box. Lots of demos and code examples. GitHub¬†repo.

John Betancur

  • üñºÔ∏è Cropper.js 2.0 ‚Äì JavaScript image cropping control. There's an online playground where you get a feel for all its¬†features.

  • üìà Perspective 3.4 ‚Äì Streaming data viz and analytics component. The core is written in C++ and compiled to WebAssembly. The homepage shows it off¬†well.

  • Happy DOM 17.3 ‚Äì Cross-runtime JS implementation of a web browser sans¬†UI.

  • EasyMDE 2.20 ‚Äì A simple Markdown editor control. Demo.

  • LogTape 0.9 ‚Äì Simple logging library for all major JS¬†runtimes.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

Meet Harmony - An open source library for composing consistent and highly performant platforms from independent business¬†features.

üèéÔ∏è Cut Integration Time ‚Äì CarsXE‚Äôs API ensures minimal setup and faster deployment for your project. Learn¬†more.

Working with in-app PDFs can be frustrating. Try Nutrient‚Äôs PDF SDK which handles problems effortlessly, so you don‚Äôt have to spend time fixing them. Used by ~1 billion end users in more than 150 different¬†countries.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of some of other interesting updates or useful resources in the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • üóìÔ∏è endoflife.date is a handy, updated source of 'end-of-life' dates for hundreds of open source projects, including Angular, Node.js, and Vue. A great resource.

  • Dive into WebGPU is a fantastic four part series on using the Web's most modern graphics API for creating striking visual effects.

  • FerretDB 2.0 is an interesting open source MongoDB alternative built on top of¬†Postgres.

  • A look at initial support for functions in CSS. Currently an experimental Chrome Canary feature¬†only.

„Äë

- ‰∏ÄÁßçÁ±ªÂûãÔºåÊ°ÜÊû∂‰∏çÂèØÁü•ËÆ∫ÔºàReactÔºåVueÔºåVueÔºåAngularÔºåSolidÂíåLitÈÉΩÂèóÂà∞ÊîØÊåÅÔºâÔºåÊó†Áî®ÁöÑÂíåÂêåÊûÑÊñπÊ≥ïÂèØ‰ª•‰∏éÂΩ¢ÂºèÂàõÂª∫Âíå‰ΩøÁî®ÂΩ¢ÂºèÔºåÂπ∂Âú®‰∏§Âπ¥ÂÜÖ‰ΩøÁî®‰∫Ü‰∏§Âπ¥ÁöÑV1.0ÈáäÊîæ„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊÇ®Â∑≤Áªè‰ΩøÁî®‰∫ÜformikÊàñreact hook form‰πãÁ±ªÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊÉ≥Áü•ÈÅìÂÆÉÁöÑ‰∏çÂêå‰πãÂ§ÑÔºå Tanner Linsley

- ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑPDFÊü•ÁúãÂô®ÔºåÁî®‰∫éReactÔºåSolidÔºåSvelteÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñJSÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇÂÆÉÂª∫Á´ãÂú®PDF.JS‰πã‰∏äÔºåÂÆÉ‰ΩøÁî®ZustandÂíå‰∏∫ÊñáÊ°£Êèê‰æõ‰∫ÜÂèçÂ∫îÊÄßÂïÜÂ∫ó„ÄÇ demo„ÄÇ

üîíÈò≤Ê≠¢AIÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫ÔºåÊ¨∫ËØàÂíåÊª•Áî®ÂÆûÊó∂ - Workos RadarÈÄöËøáÈ´òÁ∫ßËÆæÂ§áÊåáÁ∫π‰øùÊä§ÊÇ®ÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫è - ÂÅúÊ≠¢ÂÅáÁ≠æÂêçÔºåÂÖçË¥πÁ∫ßÂà´Êª•Áî®ÔºåÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫ÊîªÂáªÂíåËõÆÂäõÂ∞ùËØï„ÄÇ

item.title: „ÄêThe tale of a bizarre bug encountered in Google Docs„ÄëGoogleÊñáÊ°£‰∏≠ÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â•áÂºÇÈîôËØØÁöÑÊïÖ‰∫ã
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã729 ‚Äî March 28, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

‚≠ê¬†The State of Vue.js Report 2025 ‚Äî Created with the support of the Vue and Nuxt teams, this is no mere collection of statistics and charts (though there‚Äôs plenty of both) but a thorough update on the state of both projects and an interview with Evan You on Vue (and Vite's) latest developments. Essential reading for any Vue, Vite, or Nuxt user and a one-stop shop for understanding Vue and Nuxt as they stand right¬†now.

Monterail

Master Chrome's DevTools ‚Äî Join Jon Kuperman for this video course diving into Chrome's DevTools. You'll go beyond console.log(), learning how to inspect, debug, and audit your web apps ‚Äî tracking performance, identifying bottlenecks, making performance gains, and more. Level up your DevTools¬†skills.

Frontend Masters sponsor

War Story: The Hardest Bug I Ever Debugged ‚Äî A former engineer on the Google Docs team tells the tale of a bizarre error that afflicted Google Docs out of the blue about ten years ago. It‚Äôs a gnarly one and was only solved due to his swift access to V8‚Äôs engineers. If you‚Äôve ever spent hours digging into a bug, you‚Äôll feel glad you weren‚Äôt dealing with this¬†one!

Jacob Voytko

Next.js's Recent Middleware Security Woes ‚Äî Last weekend, a new version of Next.js landed to resolve a security vulnerability that could allow middleware to be bypassed. Self-hosted Next.js deployments need to be upgraded immediately. The news led to many responses including deep dives into the vulnerability and criticism of how it was all¬†handled.

Lee Robinson (Vercel)

IN BRIEF:

  • Cloudflare has done some work to bring the URLPattern URL matching API to Node.js and Cloudflare Workers.

  • ü§ñ If you haven't checked out Google's Gemini AI tool recently (or ever), it now supports generating HTML, JavaScript, and React code in a 'canvas' mode for building components on the¬†fly.

  • ü§ñ MCP Node.js Debugger is an attempt to make Node's debugger more accessible to third-party AI coding tools (such as Cursor or Claude Code).

  • üìä Is Vite faster than Turbopack? "Well, it depends."

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.2.7 ‚Äì Bun's HTTP server now has built-in support for reading and writing cookies using a Map-like¬†API.

  • Node v18.20.8 (LTS) ‚Äì Note that Node 18 reaches 'end-of-life' next¬†month.

  • Sinon 20.0 ‚Äì Test spies, stubs and mocks¬†library.

  • pnpm 10.7, Babel 7.27.0, ESLint 9.23.0, Neutralinojs 6.0, Material UI v7

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Writing a Tiny Undo/Redo Stack in JavaScript ‚Äî You might prefer to lean upon an established approach (using Immer patches perhaps), but if you want to implement something small yourself, this might¬†help.

Julik Tarkhanov

Land Ahoy: Leaving the Sea of Nodes ‚Äî A deeply technical post from a core member of the V8 JavaScript engine team that explains the limitations of Turbofan, one of V8‚Äôs optimizing compilers. If you don‚Äôt care for the internals of how your JavaScript is compiled and run, just be assured the V8 team is working to make it run even¬†faster.

Darius Mercadier (V8)

Which AI Model Is Best for Fixing Unit Test Errors? Claude, O3-Mini, GPT-4o? ‚Äî Better context wins every time. Wallaby provides AI with test coverage and runtime values to debug smarter. MCP support coming¬†soon.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Mission jQuery Zero: How FreeAgent Removed jQuery From Its App ‚Äî Despite popular developer sentiment, jQuery‚Äôs prevalence on the Web continues to be significant but ‚Äúsometimes legends need to¬†retire‚Äù.

Colin Gemmell

‚ñ∂¬†¬†React Query API Design: Lessons Learned ‚Äî You might know Dominik for all his work on React Query, TanStack Router, and his epic React Query - The Bad Parts series. Here, he walks us through the design choices made while building React Query and shares lessons and mistakes valuable to anyone building their own libraries. (30¬†minutes.)

Dominik Dorfmeister (TkDodo)

Deploying a Next.js App to Production on Any Server ‚Äî A popular article from last year that‚Äôs been updated for 2025 and Next.js¬†15.

Kamrannetic

üîí Protect Against AI Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

üìÑ Expressing Japanese Grammar in the TypeScript Type System ‚Äì A curious project out of left¬†field. Yifeng Wang

üìÑ Directives: A Core Feature of the Angular Toolkit Vyacheslav Borodin

üìÑ You Should Know This Before Choosing Next.js Eduardo Bou√ßas

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Babylon.js 8.0: Microsoft's JavaScript 3D Engine ‚Äî 8.0 adds support for improved ‚Äòimage based lighting‚Äô and ‚Äòarea lights‚Äô for environmental lighting and shadows, extra control of the render pipeline, and a new lightweight viewer. And, as always, they have ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†a short video showing it all¬†off.

Microsoft

ü§ñ¬†An MCP Server for Playwright and Browser Automation ‚Äî MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers enable certain LLM-based agents (such as Claude, Claude Code, and Cursor) to perform actions on a system outside of their usual sandbox. This new project from Microsoft enables such LLMs to interact with browsers via¬†Playwright.

Microsoft

Lexical 0.29: An Easy-to-Extend Text Editor Framework from Meta ‚Äî A text editor framework built by Meta with extensibility, accessibility, and cross platform support in mind (there‚Äôs even a Swift variant for iOS). There‚Äôs a live playground if you want to give it a¬†try.

Meta / Facebook

üîé¬†Fuzzball: Fuzzy String Matching Library ‚Äî To tackle those cases where what‚Äôs typed isn‚Äôt quite what‚Äôs wanted. There‚Äôs a neat tree-themed Web-based¬†demo.

Nolan

  • Axios 0.30 ‚Äì Long-standing, promise-based isomorphic HTTP¬†client.

  • Solito 4.4 ‚Äì React Native +¬†Next.js. Now supporting Next.js¬†15.

  • InversifyJS 7.2 ‚Äì Inversion of control container for¬†JavaScript.

  • jscodeshift 17.3 ‚Äì JavaScript codemod toolkit from¬†Facebook.

  • Verdaccio 6.1 ‚Äì Lightweight Node.js private proxy¬†registry.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

üìä Jspreadsheet ‚Äì Lightweight JS data grid with Excel-like controls. Create rich web spreadsheets fast. Try it¬†now.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of other interesting updates and useful resources from across the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • <select> elements have always been notoriously tricky to style with CSS but there's a new standardized approach beginning to become available.

  • ls-lint is a mature tool for linting file and directory¬†names.

  • Someone's managed to get Go code to compile and run on the PlayStation¬†2.

  • üëë People's experiments with TypeScript's type system continue with the latest creation being a chess engine built from TypeScript types.

  • LLM wrangler Simon Willison was getting annoyed at being unable to easily visualize incomplete JSON documents so he built an 'incomplete JSON' pretty¬†printer.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Babel 7.27.0, ESLint 9.23.0,

darius MercadierÔºàV8Ôºâ

Âì™ÁßçAIÊ®°ÂûãÊúÄÈÄÇÂêàËß£ÂÜ≥ÂçïÂÖÉÊµãËØïÈîôËØØÔºüClaudeÔºåO3-MiniÔºåGPT-4OÔºü - ÊØèÊ¨°Êõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑ‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñáÈÉΩ‰ºöËé∑ËÉú„ÄÇWallaby‰∏∫AIÊèê‰æõ‰∫ÜAIÁöÑÊµãËØïË¶ÜÁõñÁéáÂíåËøêË°åÊó∂ÂÄºÔºåÂèØË∞ÉËØïMCP Support„ÄÇ

wallabyÂõ¢Èòü

- Â∞ΩÁÆ°ÂèóÊ¨¢ËøéÁöÑÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÊÉÖÁª™Ôºå‰ΩÜJQueryÂú®ÁΩëÁªú‰∏äÁöÑÊµÅË°å‰ªçÁÑ∂ÂæàÈáçË¶ÅÔºå‰ΩÜ‚ÄúÊúâÊó∂ÊòØ‰º†Â•áÈúÄË¶ÅÈÄÄ‰ºë‚Äù„ÄÇ

Colin Gemmell

‚ñ∂ - ÊÇ®ÂèØËÉΩËÆ§ËØÜÂ§öÁ±≥Â∞ºÂÖãÂú®ReactÊü•ËØ¢ÔºåTanstack RouterÂíå‰ªñÁöÑEpic Query -Query -the Query -the Query -theÁ≥ªÂàóÔºà30ÂàÜÈíüÔºâ

dominik dorfmeisterÔºàtkdodoÔºâ

- ÂéªÂπ¥ÁöÑÊµÅË°åÊñáÁ´†Â∑≤Âú®2025Âπ¥ÂíåNext.JS 15Êõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÇ

„ÄÇ

item.title: „ÄêCan you understand this JavaScript?„ÄëÊÇ®ËÉΩÁêÜËß£Ëøô‰∏™JavaScriptÂêóÔºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã727 ‚Äî March 14, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Perplexing JavaScript Parsing Puzzle ‚Äî It looks deceptively simple ‚Äì just 14 characters of JavaScript ‚Äì but after working with JavaScript for 29 years, I got it wrong. A clue: it goes back to a browser-related quirk from 30 years¬†ago..

Hillel Wayne

TypeScript's Compiler to Get 10x Faster ‚Äî TypeScript has shaken up the JavaScript ecosystem in recent years with an increasing number of developers relying on its strong typing and added structure. TypeScript‚Äôs compiler isn‚Äôt particularly fast, though, but the TypeScript team at Microsoft are changing that by porting it to¬†Go!

Anders Hejlsberg (Microsoft)

üí° Dr. Axel Rauschmayer takes a closer look at the details behind the¬†port.

Build a Secure Project Management ‚Äî Learn a security-first approach to building web applications by building a secure project management platform with¬†Next.js.

Clerk sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • Node.js v20.19.0 (LTS) is a notable release for a maintenance branch of Node as an exception has been made to the maintenance policy for backporting require(esm) support, which is now enabled by¬†default.

  • The latest version of Chrome (and preview versions of Firefox and Safari) support two new HTML attributes, command and commandfor, for adding declarative actions to HTML buttons without directly requiring¬†JavaScript.

RELEASES:

  • Nuxt 3.16 ‚Äì Popular Vue meta-framework. Now with a new create-nuxt tool for starting¬†projects.

  • Bun 1.2.5 ‚Äì Now with much better Node-API compatibility, CSRF generation and verification, plus numerous perf improvements and¬†fixes.

  • Melange 5 ‚Äì An OCaml-to-JavaScript compiler.

  • Astro 5.5, Transformers.js 3.4, Capacitor 7.1, Nuxt UI v3

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Building APIs with Next.js ‚Äî A detailed, official introduction to the concepts behind using Next.js‚Äô App Router and route handlers to build public APIs you can expose to web, mobile, and third-party¬†clients.

Lee Robinson

How The New York Times Migrated from Enzyme to React Testing¬†Library ‚Äî A thorough look at the technical challenges and strategies the NYT used to perform a piecemeal upgrade of its React testing approach without disrupting either end users or other¬†developers.

Felipe Buena√±o (NYT Open Team)

Which AI Model Is Best for Fixing Unit Test Errors? Claude, o3-mini, GPT-4o? ‚Äî Better context wins every time. Wallaby enters the chat to give AI what it needs - test coverage and runtime values - to debug¬†smarter.

Wallaby Team sponsor

How ECMAScript Engines Optimize Your Variables ‚Äî From the authors of the Boa JS Rust-powered JavaScript¬†engine.

Boa Developers

üìÑ Use Cases for the Document Picture-in-Picture API ‚Äì A way to open a floating, always-on-top window (‚Äòpicture-in-picture‚Äô) that can display arbitrary HTML content. Chrome only, though. Jad Joubran

üìÑ Using Intl.DurationFormat to Format Time Durations with Locale Support Trevor I. Lasn

üìÑ Learn Zod So You Can Trust Your Data and Your Types Diana MacDonald

üìÑ 10 Hidden Gems in Angular That You Should Use IE 33

üìÑ Underrated Angular Features Armen Vardanyan

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Refractor 5.0: Robust Virtual Syntax Highlighting using Prism ‚Äî Wraps the powerful Prism syntax highlighter to output objects instead of an HTML string so you can manipulate and render it as you wish (e.g. in a VDOM or at the terminal). Lowlight, by the same author, offers the same functionality but backed by highlight.js.

Titus Wormer

svg2pdf.js: SVG to PDF Conversion in the Browser ‚Äî There‚Äôs an online playground to give you a feel for what it can¬†do.

yWorks GmbH

üîí Protect Against AI Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

‚åòK: A Fast, Composable, Unstyled 'Command Menu' Control ‚Äî The home page includes some neat examples in a variety of styles. GitHub repo. Needs React¬†18+.

Paco Coursey

üîé¬†Node Modules Inspector ‚Äî A tool that runs pnpm inside your browser, ‚Äúinstalls‚Äù a package, then analyzes its dependencies. This can be useful for analyzing packages you already use, but also for simplifying your own projects, as 11ty‚Äôs Zach Leatherman did¬†here.

Anthony Fu

PGlite: Run Postgres in WebAssembly ‚Äî PGlite packages a WASM build of Postgres into a TypeScript library that can be run directly from Node.js (or Bun, Deno, and even the browser) and it‚Äôs only a few megabytes in¬†size.

ElectricSQL / Neon

  • Gleam 1.9 ‚Äì Type-safe functional programming language that targets both the Erlang VM and JavaScript¬†runtime.

  • <css-doodle> 0.42 ‚Äì Web component for drawing patterns with CSS.

  • Faker 9.6 ‚Äì Generate fabricated data to your heart's¬†content.

  • Choices 11.1 ‚Äì Configurable select box/text input¬†plugin.

  • üïí Spacetime 7.8 ‚Äì Lightweight timezone¬†library.

  • Ink 5.2 ‚Äì Use React to build CLI¬†apps.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

Current PDF setup slowing you down? Try Nutrient's PDF SDK ‚Äî it's used by IBM, SAP, DocuSign and countless others to open, edit, and customize with ease across¬†platforms.

üëÄ Give your eyes a break! MonoLisa is a font optimized for developers. Try¬†now.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of some of other interesting updates or useful resources in the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • ‚≠ê A fantastic introduction to latency in IO devices (above) over on the PlanetScale blog, complete with very useful interactive diagrams built in¬†JavaScript.

  • The Evil Martians explain things you can consider to make your open source project more popular.

  • ü§ñ Esteemed LLM-whisperer Simon Willison drops a ton of insights and tips on how he uses LLMs to help him write code.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

È¢úËâ≤ÔºöÔºÉ3366aa;‚Äú>Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

TypeScript's Compiler to Get 10x Faster ‚Äî TypeScript has shaken up the JavaScript ecosystem in recent years with an increasing number of developers relying on its strong typing and added structure.‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÊâìÂ≠óÁ®øÁöÑÁºñËØëÂô®Âπ∂‰∏çÊòØÁâπÂà´Âø´Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØMicrosoftÁöÑÊâìÂ≠óÁ®øÂõ¢ÈòüÊ≠£Âú®ÈÄöËøáÁßªÊ§çÂÆÉÊù•Êõ¥ÊîπÂÆÉÔºÅ

Anders HejlsbergÔºàMicrosoftÔºâ

  • requireÔºàesmÔºâÊîØÊåÅÔºåÈªòËÆ§ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÂêØÁî®„ÄÇ

  • ÊúÄÊñ∞ÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑChromeÔºàÂíåFirefoxÂíåSafariÁöÑÈ¢ÑËßàÁâàÊú¨ÔºâÊîØÊåÅ ÔºåÂú®‰∏çÁõ¥Êé•ÈúÄË¶ÅJavaScriptÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÂêëHTMLÊåâÈíÆÊ∑ªÂä†Â£∞ÊòéÊÄßÊìç‰Ωú„ÄÇ

ÂèëË°åÔºö

  • create-nuxt Áî®‰∫éÂêØÂä®È°πÁõÆÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÇ

üõ†‰ª£Á†ÅÂíåÂ∑•ÂÖ∑

‚Äî Wraps the powerful Prism syntax highlighter to output objects instead of an HTML string so you can manipulate and render it as you wish (e.g. in a VDOM or atÁªàÁ´ØÔºâ„ÄÇ lowlight ÔºåÁî±Âêå‰∏Ä‰Ωç‰ΩúËÄÖÊèê‰æõÁõ∏ÂêåÁöÑÂäüËÉΩÔºå‰ΩÜÁî± titus wormer

- Âú®Á∫øÊ∏∏‰πêÂú∫ÂèØ‰ª•ËÆ©ÊÇ®ÊÑüËßâÂà∞ÂÆÉÁöÑÊÑüËßâ„ÄÇ

yworks gmbh

- Workos RadarÈÄöËøáÈ´òÁ∫ßËÆæÂ§áÊåáÁ∫π‰øùÊä§ÊÇ®ÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫è - ÂÅúÊ≠¢‰º™ÈÄ†ÁöÑÊ≥®ÂÜåÔºåÂÖçË¥πÁöÑÂ±ÇÊª•Áî®ÔºåÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫ÊîªÂáªÂíåËõÆÂäõÂ∞ùËØï„ÄÇ

workos

- ‰∏ªÈ°µÂåÖÊã¨ÂêÑÁßçÊ†∑ÂºèÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÊï¥Ê¥ÅÁ§∫‰æã„ÄÇ github repo „ÄÇÈúÄÊ±ÇÂèçÂ∫î18+„ÄÇ

paco Coursey

ËäÇÁÇπÊ®°ÂùóInspector - ‰∏ÄÁßçÂú®ÊµèËßàÂô®ÂÜÖÈÉ®ËøêË°åpnpm ÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºå‚ÄúÂÆâË£Ö‚Äù‰∏Ä‰∏™ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂàÜÊûêÂÖ∂‰æùËµñÂÖ≥Á≥ª„ÄÇËøôÂØπ‰∫éÂàÜÊûêÊÇ®Â∑≤Áªè‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÂèØËÉΩÂæàÊúâÁî®Ôºå‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÁÆÄÂåñËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÔºåÂ¶Ç 11tyÁöÑZach LeathermanÂú®ËøôÈáåÂÅöËøá„ÄÇ

Anthony Fu

- PGLITEËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖA WASMÊûÑÂª∫PostgresÊûÑÂª∫Âà∞ÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•‰ªéNode.jsÔºàÊàñBUNÔºåDENOÁîöËá≥ÊµèËßàÂô®ÔºâÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑÂ§ßÂ∞èÂè™ÊúâÂá†ÂÖÜÂ≠óËäÇ„ÄÇ

electricsql / neon < / p>

  • üïí

üì∞ÂàÜÁ±ª

ÂΩìÂâçPDFËÆæÁΩÆÈÄüÂ∫¶Èôç‰Ωé‰∫ÜÊÇ®Ôºü üëÄËÆ©‰Ω†ÁöÑÁúºÁùõÁùÅÂºÄÔºÅ

  • ‚≠êÈùûÂ∏∏Âú®JavaScript‰∏≠ÊûÑÂª∫ÁöÑÊúâÁî®ÁöÑ‰∫§‰∫íÂºèÂõæ„ÄÇ

  • ÈÇ™ÊÅ∂ÁöÑÁÅ´Êòü‰∫∫Ëß£ÈáäÊÇ®ÂèØ‰ª•ËÄÉËôë‰ΩøÂºÄÊ∫êÈ°πÁõÆÊõ¥ÂèóÊ¨¢ËøéÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇ

item.title: „ÄêThe Rsdoctor will see you now„ÄëRSDOCTORÁé∞Âú®‰ºöËßÅÊÇ®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã728 ‚Äî March 21, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Rsdoctor 1.0: An Analyzer for Rspack and Webpack ‚Äî A one-stop, intelligent build analyzer making it easier to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance. It‚Äôs part of the same family of tools as Rspack (a Rust-powered web bundler) but is fully webpack compatible. If you‚Äôve ever asked why your build times are too long, this is for¬†you.

ByteDance Inc.

üí° In other Rust-powered JavaScript tooling news, the Oxlint JavaScript linter is now in beta. Imagine ESLint, but it runs in seconds on large codebases (indeed, it can process Microsoft's VS Code repo in under a¬†second).

Add Excel-like Spreadsheet Functionality to Your JavaScript Apps ‚Äî SpreadJS is the industry-leading JavaScript spreadsheet for adding advanced spreadsheet features to your enterprise apps. Build finance, analysis, budget, and other apps. Excel I/O, 500+ calc functions, tables, charts, and more. View demos¬†now.

SpreadJS from MESCIUS inc sponsor

üìâ¬†How We Made Our Rich Text Editor Load Faster ‚Äî CKEditor is a long-standing, full featured GPL and commercially licensed rich text editor but its complexity can come with a performance cost. In this two part series (part two here), the CKEditor team digs into how they‚Äôve recently significantly boosted its¬†performance.

Szymon Cofalik (CKEditor)

Next.js vs TanStack ‚Äî An incisive essay from a developer who‚Äôs had enough of the Next.js approach and has found solace in the approach offered by the increasingly capable TanStack collection of tools (as well as¬†Vite).

Kyle Gill

IN BRIEF:

  • This automatically updated runtime compatibility table lets you see how/if different server-side JavaScript runtimes support different¬†APIs.

  • üí¨ If you'd like to hang out on Discord and chat with other Node.js developers, there's now an official Node.js Discord server.

  • The Node.js TSC has voted to stop distributing Corepack with future versions of Node. Corepack was originally introduced as a way to manage other package managers.

  • üõ†Ô∏è Make Bookmarklets is a handy tool for turning JavaScript into bookmarklet code that you can use directly in a browser¬†bookmark.

RELEASES:

  • Parcel v2.14.0 ‚Äì The zero-config bundler adds a new CLI to scaffold apps, first-class MDX support, and beta support for React Server Components.

  • Ionic 8.5 ‚Äì Cross-platform JS app development¬†platform.

  • üìä Billboard.js 3.15.0 ‚Äì D3-powered JS chart library.

  • React Router 7.4

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

How to Build a Snake AI Game with Docker and TensorFlow.js ‚Äî You‚Äôve probably heard about people ‚Äòvibe coding‚Äô games by letting LLMs do the coding work, but what if you want to build a game yourself that has neural network powered elements? TensorFlow.js offers one¬†solution that you could just as easily adapt to non-gaming¬†contexts.

Manvar and Raina (Docker)

The Great ESLint v9 Migration Adventure: A Developer's Survival¬†Guide ‚Äî ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just say‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve seen things. I hit all the bumps, took all the wrong turns, and somehow made it to the other side‚Äîso you don‚Äôt have¬†to.‚Äù

Yacine Kharoubi

üîí Protect Against AI Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

React Trends in 2025 ‚Äî Each year Robin does a post giving his opinion on what trends he sees arising over the next year. Last year, he put his money on Astro, RSCs, Vercel, and Biome ‚Äì this year he points at React Server Components, shadcn/ui, TanStack Start, React Router, and¬†more.

Robin Wieruch

Build a Custom RAG AI Agent with TypeScript and Jupyter ‚Äî Deno, Ollama, and a few different AI models come together in this tutorial for storing document embeddings in a vector store and querying them for use in a basic¬†agent.

Kitson Kelly

üìÑ Training AI to Uncover Malicious JavaScript Intent and Make the Web Safer Cejuela and Zheng (Cloudflare)

üìÑ Lazy Load Background Images with the IntersectionObserver API Anna Monus

üìÑ Web Components vs. Framework Components:¬†What‚Äôs the Difference? Gabriel Shoyombo

üìÑ Detecting Browser Zoom Changes in JavaScript Kirupa Chinnathambi

üìÑ Making a Browser Based Game With Vanilla JS and CSS Eoin McGrath

üìÑ Deno Shows Us There's a Better Way Mac Chaffee

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Introducing Motion for Vue ‚Äî Motion is a popular and powerful animation library most commonly associated with React, but now there‚Äôs a new Vue flavor and it‚Äôs feature complete, too.

Matt Perry (Motion)

Reveal.js 5.2: The HTML Presentation Framework ‚Äî Brings elegant presentations to anyone with a Web browser. v5.2 adds the ability to trigger ‚Äòlightboxes‚Äô where viewers can see images and videos in a way where they stand out¬†more.

Hakim El Hattab

Introducing @clerk/agent-toolkit ‚Äî Build agentic systems with support for user and organizational management. Compatible with Vercel's AI SDK and¬†LangChain.

Clerk sponsor

Konva: A JavaScript 2D Canvas Library ‚Äî The native API for Canvas elements is pretty good, but Konva is a popular abstraction that sits on top and provides a more structured way to work with shapes, styling, events, animations, and more (lots of demos with code). It also has extra integration libraries for Vue, Svelte and React.

Konva

Typist 8.0: Tiptap-Based Rich Text Editor Component ‚Äî Simple and opinionated. You can try several examples linked in the sidebar. Well suited for basic rich text situations like writing comments or messages and has a single-line mode. GitHub¬†repo.

Doist

PeanoScript: TypeScript But It's a Theorem Prover ‚Äî An experimental proof assistant for Peano arithmetic based on TypeScript¬†syntax.

mjgrzymek

  • Gridstack.js 11.5 ‚Äì Build responsive interactive dashboards¬†quickly.

  • Repomix 0.3 ‚Äì Pack an entire repository into a single, AI-friendly¬†file.

  • DOCX 9.3 ‚Äì Generate .docx / Word¬†files from¬†JavaScript.

  • üñºÔ∏è Parvus 3.0 ‚Äì Dependency-free image lightbox¬†control.

  • BlockNote 0.26 ‚Äì 'Notion-style' block-based¬†editor.

  • ü§ñ wllama 2.3 ‚Äì WebAssembly binding for¬†llama.cpp.

  • Pixi.js 8.9 ‚Äì Fast, flexible 2D WebGL¬†renderer.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üéπ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trial¬†available.

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

üìä Jspreadsheet ‚Äì Lightweight JS data grid with Excel-like controls. Create rich web spreadsheets fast. Try it¬†now.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of other interesting updates and useful resources from across the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • John Tuckner took a look at the murky world of buying browser extensions for 'fun and profit.'

  • If you're using VS Code and GitHub Copilot, did you know you can ask Copilot about VS Code's own features?

  • Ever wondered what's involved in building a container image from scratch?

  • A look at building a Lisp interpreter in 66 lines of JavaScript.

  • "As an engineer, I‚Äôd rather be called stupid than stay silent."

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

the Oxlint JavaScript linter is now in beta. Imagine ESLint, but it runs in seconds on large codebases (indeed, it can process Microsoft's VS Code repo in under a¬†second).

Mescius Inc

‚Äî CKEditor is a long-standing, full featured GPL and commercially licensed rich text editor but its complexity can come with a performance cost.Âú®Ëøô‰∏™‰∏§‰∏™ÈÉ®ÂàÜÁ≥ªÂàó‰∏≠ÔºàÂú®ËøôÈáåÁ¨¨‰∫åÈÉ®ÂàÜÔºâÔºåckeditorÂõ¢ÈòüÊúÄËøëÊåñÊéò‰∫Ü‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊúÄËøëÁöÑË°®Áé∞„ÄÇ

  • üõ†Ô∏è

ÂèëË°åÔºö

  • üìä

Training AI to Uncover Malicious JavaScript Intent and Make the Web Safer Cejuela and Zheng (Cloudflare)

üìÑüìÑ WebÁªÑ‰ª∂‰∏éÊ°ÜÊû∂ÁªÑ‰ª∂ÔºöÊúâ‰ªÄ‰πàÂå∫Âà´Ôºü Gabriel Shoyombo

üìÑüìÑüìÑ

üì¢ÂÖ∂‰ªñÂú∞Êñπ

‰ªéÊõ¥ÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÊôØËßÇ‰∏≠ÁöÑÂÖ∂‰ªñÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÊõ¥Êñ∞ÂíåÊúâÁî®ÁöÑËµÑÊ∫êËøõË°åÂø´ÈÄüÁªºËø∞Ôºö
